file_content.text: This place is worse than Rishi! No cantinas, no sabacc games, no fun at all!
My master wishes to report that the surrounding terrain is quite rugged. The Revanites are based in an ancient temple nearby. We found no usable supplies or shelter.
The other scouts gave similar reports. There has been some contact with Revanite patrols, but no heavy resistance as yet.
I can feel the Emperor's presence here. I'd know it anywhere. But that presence isn't alone.
There is so much darkness here... it's difficult to get any sense of specifics in the environment.
The Emperor isn't the only Sith to have left his mark on this place.
We've got a base camp, elevation, decent perimeter... bring me up to speed on the rest.
Looks like you've settled in pretty well. Catch me up.
We need better eyes on the region around us. Scouts can only patrol so far in brush this dense.
It is more than that. I sense their fear. Their distrust. This world is mired in ancient hatreds, and we have brought more than our share already.
Was there a suggestion somewhere in all that?
The troops are too distracted by each other to keep a proper lookout. They're expecting to be stabbed in the back.
Then we'll set an extended perimeter past the outer guards, and make it impartial. Sensor equipment doesn't pick sides.
I can take care of that.
Good, I'm sick of this place already.
Once our position is secure, we can focus on Revan.
Do we know any more about how Revan is intending to bring the Emperor back?
Any word on Revan's plans?
If you're thinking about attacking the others while I'm gone? Think again.
Don't try anything, Marr.
I'm going to get those sensors running. Keep me informed.
I'd better get to it, then.
Always.
Good luck.
Enough. I will wrench the information we need from this... man. The rest can be settled later.
Why not let Master Satele have a try at that?
Satele should question him.
Do not push me further.
Violence is what drove him into his current state. More will only make him worse.
You're welcome to observe everything. But a gentler hand will be more successful--I'm sure of it.
I'm betting the Guard are trained to resist torture.
I've got a feeling torture is something this guy has seen plenty of.
It can't hurt to try something different. You're free to watch--no secrets.
Let's get this over with.
It's more like therapy in there than an interrogation. I think we're close to a breakthrough, though.
Master Satele's techniques are... interesting. And rather effective, I must admit. I think we'll have the information we need very soon.
Interrogate him however you see fit.
Proceed, Marr.
I encourage you to observe. I have no need for secrets.
Darth Marr's techniques are quite effective. I don't believe we'll have much longer to wait.
You sense it too. Not the ancient Sith, or the Emperor. Not Revan. Another presence... different from the rest.
Yes. It is more like you.
I sense it too. Is it really possible that a light side presence could exist here?
The light can flourish anywhere.
Apparently.
Are you saying there's another Jedi somewhere near us?
No Jedi could survive here alone. It is a vestige at most.
You sell us a bit short, Marr.
But, in answer to your question, no: the presence isn't exactly that of a Jedi, either. It's still very difficult to pinpoint.
Sensors are picking up something a bit more solid. Large structures, mixture of ancient and modern materials... looks like they've been ransacked. Lots of debris.
Check for broadcasts in signal range forty-seven point two.
What am I seeing here? It's encoded.
The facts behind a rumor. That signal range is used only by the Imperial Guard. The structure we've found must be their training facility.
I fought the Imperial Guard on Corellia. They were dangerous opponents.
The Imperial Guard are tough.
They might be broadcasting something we could use. Can you decode it?
What are they broadcasting?
No--only the Guard has that capability. But given the destruction Theron describes, it's most likely a distress call.
Rumor? Are you telling us you never knew where the Imperial Guard came from?
A rumor? What do you mean?
The Emperor's inner circle guards its secrets carefully.
If the Guard has a facility here, they may have information on the Emperor's hiding place--that would lead us straight to Revan.
Agreed. As this concerns only Imperial interests, I will assemble a team of my own to investigate. Beniko--with me.
We can't sit back and watch. There's no telling what they might pull out of that facility--we can't just take their word for it.
Hurry--while Marr is gathering his team. Make your way out of the camp and search the Imperial Guard base, as quickly as possible.
We'll stall the Imps as much as we can. Let's just hope this doesn't turn ugly....
Be careful.
We'll need our full strength to defeat Revan when the time comes. Don't do anything to jeopardize that.
The Sith are prone to aggression as it is. Don't give them a reason to indulge their darkness.
Don't start a fight just to cover for me. It's not worth the risk.
Just don't get in over your heads. That's more my specialty.
Are you sure this is wise?
No one knows betrayal better than Sith. They won't ignore what we're doing here.
Trust is in very short supply right now. I'm not sure it's best to gamble what little we have.
I've seen more than one covert op that backfired when the truth came out. Is this worth the risk?
Nobody likes getting conned, and Sith aren't exactly forgiving. Doing this could wreck the truce for good.
Ugly is fine with me.
Try not to start any serious fighting until I'm back. I wouldn't want to miss out.
If I return, and all of the Imperials are dead? All the better.
If things get bloody, just be sure to leave some Imps for me.
I wouldn't mind seeing a few less Imps around camp when I get back.
Are we ready?
All teams report ready. You've done very well--all of the soldiers here look up to you, Imperial and Republic both.
Let's proceed.
All units--move out!
All units report success. The weapon has been shut down, and all Revanites neutralized. Only one more left to deal with.
My team shut down the Sith device. Revan tried to intervene, but we managed to drive him away.
Impressive. We have prepared a joint assault force to secure the area and pacify any remaining enemies.
Iven told us where Revan might go. The Emperor's final sanctuary.
We've got speeders prepped. You won't be facing him alone.
Then let's begin.
I'll take all the backup I can get. Let's move.
Well, then. Let's settle this so we can all go home.
This was an Imperial matter. Your Jedi had no place in it.
I told you this was an Imperial matter. Your soldier's involvement was... unwelcome.
This was an Imperial matter. Your... associate... was not needed.
We're supposed to be working together. If the situations were reversed, wouldn't you have done the same thing?
You don't trust us.
If you trusted us, having me involved wouldn't have been an issue.
And you trust us?
This is a dangerous game you play.
We were concerned, and we acted. We should have left this to you. Apologies.
You're right--and we're sorry.
You don't speak for them.
Betrayal is the core of your beliefs! You can't honestly find this surprising.
Get over it.
Is it surprise that you hear in my voice?
Kill each other now, wait until later, it's all the same! It all fuels the flame!
Allowing this torture makes us no better than Revan.
We can be better than Revan after he's dealt with.
I need to meditate on the path ahead. There must be a way forward without such sacrifices.
And at least a few of us had better check up on Marr and Lana.
It's not pretty in there. Don't think the guy can hold out much longer, though.
We cut it pretty close on this one. Doesn't take a Jedi to see how angry Marr was.
How are you holding up? Everything has been happening so fast....
I've been through my share of tough times. I can handle this.
I'll be all right.
Good to hear. I have a feeling things are only going to get tougher.
You had mentioned that you weren't particularly close to your mother... has working together been good or bad?
What about you?
Honestly, I'm not sure. There hasn't been a lot of time to think about it. But we work well together.
We've been chasing Revan down long enough. I just want to end this.
I'm ready to finish this.
I couldn't agree more.
I want you to know, I advised against Marr's plan with the Guard facility.
We've come so far together... I'd hate to see that progress ruined by territoriality.
This truce is only as strong as our trust in each other.
I agree.
Then with our guidance, I think it can only become stronger as we proceed.
Are you worried about keeping the truce together, or were you thinking more about the two of us?
Is this about the truce, or us?
Both, I suppose.
If you don't agree with Marr, why follow him? Just kill him and take his place--that's how it works for Sith, isn't it?
So take Marr down.
Short-sighted infighting is what brought the Empire to its current state. I won't take part in that.
The guard broke! He is telling them everything!
I thought the interrogation we faced on Manaan was severe... Darth Marr made that little session seem like a picnic!
I must say, Master Satele is quite a pleasant interrogator. Theron should be quite proud!
Let's find out what we're up against.
A "device for mass ritual sacrifice"? That's seriously what he called it?
Capable of killing every living thing on this moon, as fuel for the Emperor's resurrection.
And housed within the very temple the Revanites are using as their base of operations.
So we'll have to breach the temple and shut the weapon down before Revan can activate it.
Getting inside at all will be challenging enough.
The temple entrance has a locking system that can be overridden from the outside, provided we find the right mechanisms.
On it.
It is strange that one bad deal could lead us to such bizarre circumstances.
I certainly never thought we'd be killed by an ancient Sith murder machine!
The life of Jakarro has been full of fine adventures, but this one is the greatest of all.
We're fortunate to have run into each other.
I'm glad to have your help.
You might not be so grateful if we don't get that weapon shut down.
Thank me when we win.
We didn't exactly have a choice. Everywhere we go, you follow.
I can't seem to get rid of you.
You need our help! There is no shame in admitting it.
Among the most dangerous in the galaxy.
We won't.
We don't have any other options. Trust is hard enough when we're on even footing. If they get an edge on us? Forget it.
Please, hurry. And may the Force be with you.
Let's just hope it doesn't come to that, huh?
May the Force be with you.
Everything about the Emperor is a mystery, even to the Dark Council. Speed is our only ally now.
We'll keep in touch while you're getting those sensors up.
The Imperials are leaving a small force of volunteers behind to watch for any further activity from the Revanites or the Emperor. We'll be doing the same.
Your actions are... confusing, to say the least. I don't appreciate being left in the dark.
Does the Supreme Commander share these concerns, Chancellor?
He does not. But that is hardly--
The two of us have been fighting this war for quite some time now. We know what we're doing--and we appreciate your trust in us.
Just as I'll appreciate being informed when your fleet is back in position. Saresh out.
I guess ignoring the boss runs in the family.
Where are we planning to go from here?
What's our next move?
There's nothing left for us on Yavin Four anyway. No point in staying.
We were done here anyway.
Ignoring Saresh is always a good idea.
I've never liked Saresh.
Never knew you were so political.
Our forces are preparing to launch.
I should make sure ours are ready to do the same.
It's strange. The next time we meet, our circumstances will be... quite different.
Well, don't take it personally, but I'm hoping that you'll never see me again.
Hah. And I'll hope that I do.
I'm gonna see if Satele needs any help. Catch me later.
Well. Our time has come, even sooner than I'd feared.
Revan is gone. We've accomplished what we set out to do. But now we have an entirely new problem, and no truce to face it.
Do you know if the Dark Council has a plan for how to move forward?
Does the Empire have a plan?
We've shown that it's possible to ignore our differences. Maybe there's hope for a real treaty.
So let's get the truce back.
I'm not afraid of the Emperor. He'll be taken care of soon enough.
We can handle it.
I wish I shared your optimism.
What's next for the illustrious Jedi? It sounded as though your Grand Master is about to become quite busy.
I will go wherever the Council decides I'm needed. That's the life of a Jedi.
Whatever the Order requires.
We aren't so different after all.
I walk whatever path the Force lays out for me.
We'll see.
You always seem to find your way into the middle of grand things regardless.
If you were to abandon the Sith, I imagine I'd be busy teaching you our ways.
Depends, will you defect?
I'm afraid that won't be possible.
What's next for the Republic's most decorated soldier? Surely even Havoc Squad gets vacations every now and then?
With everything that's happened, I doubt I'll have the chance for any vacation.
No time for a break.
Maybe I'll just disappear for a bit. Surely the Republic can get by without me for a little while.
Vacation would be nice.
Bringing in a Sith defector will mean lots of forms to fill out. It'd be worth it, though.
Depends, will you defect?
What's next for the galaxy's most notorious smuggler? After everything that's happened, I imagine you're even more in-demand than ever.
I go where the work is, and the Republic's bound to have a lot of it coming up.
You've got that right.
I'm sure the Republic will ask me for one thing or another. Parades, banquets... few medals, of course.
A break would be nice.
I was figuring we'd be going on a tour of the galaxy's finer hot spots.
Depends--will you come with me?
If only.
I'm not at all sure what my future holds. But the future doesn't have to start for a while yet.
For now... I'd like to make the most of the present.
Agreed. [Kiss her]
There's nothing I'd like more.
I'm going to miss you.
I'm going to miss you, too, Lana.
The feeling is mutual.
Farewell.
Give me a call if you ever want to change sides.
You can still defect.
You'll be the first to know.
Come on. Sith aren't supposed to go in for all that mushy nonsense.
Don't get sentimental.
Sith do whatever they like.
We've gone as far as we can go, Lana. Any further, and we'll both regret it.
We need to move on.
Hm. Suit yourself. But I would rather regret something I did, than something I was afraid to do.
Stay safe.
I'm glad we could put aside our differences and achieve so much. It's been quite interesting.
It's been a pleasure working with you, Lana. Strange, but a pleasure.
Agreed.
You don't have to go back, Lana. You aren't like them.
Why return to the Empire?
This truce ends the moment you're gone. If we meet again, don't expect any mercy.
From now on, you're the enemy.
A traditional Sith farewell. You're so thoughtful.
Until next time.
Well. Quite a ride, huh? Revan's down, the conspiracy's over... I even got my job back. Wonders never cease.
The SIS is lucky to have you back.
Well deserved.
With the Emperor back, I have a feeling things are going to get even more interesting.
The ride isn't over yet.
The Emperor still managed to come back. I'd call that a mixed result at best.
We could've done better.
We did everything we possibly could have.
It's funny. You're this famous Jedi, but since we started working together, you've been a spy, a saboteur, a fake pirate... How'd you pull it all off so well?
A Jedi's responsibilities can lead to many different situations. Adaptability is important.
Jedi must be adaptable.
Honestly, I feel more at home with all of that than I ever have meditating in the temple.
I never fit in with the Jedi.
With help as good as you, everything is easy.
Teamwork is everything.
I always knew you were one hell of a soldier. But it turns out you can swing the spy game, work undercover, even run with a bunch of pirates.
I wasn't surprised that you could hold your own with the underworld crowd. But all this spycraft, sabotage, tracking down targets... not exactly textbook smuggler stuff.
I don't know how else to explain it. I'm just really good at everything.
I'm just that good.
If I'd known there was a textbook, I'd have pretended to read it by now.
There's a textbook?
It's possible you might have pitched in a little bit along the way.
You may have helped a little.
I guess there's at least an outside chance.
Before we get going... there's just one last thing I had in mind. If you think you can keep up.
...Is that what you had in mind?
You're on. [Kiss him]
It's a start.
Just like I thought. Good at everything.
Come on. Let's go see what's next for the best in the Republic.
I've had fun, Theron. But you have your life, and I have mine. We'd never match up.
We shouldn't.
Hm. Can't win 'em all, I guess.
Come on. Let's go check up on the bosses.
All units report success. The temple is secured, and all remaining Revanites have been downed. Just one left, now.
Don't count me as one of your volunteers!
As it happens, Jakarro and I have received several lucrative business offers. Various acquaintances made on Rishi, nothing to concern yourselves with.
That being said, we have sincerely enjoyed our time with you, and would gladly provide our services again at any time!
The droid babbles, but speaks the truth. This has been fun!
I hope these new opportunities go better than the Manaan job. Take care.
Good luck to you both.
We will do that! No one will fool the mighty Jakarro again!
Why go work with someone else? I'd be happy to have you stick around and join my crew.
You should join my crew.
A tempting offer!
The mighty Jakarro will consider it--but for now, these deals are too good to pass up!
Farewell!
I honestly can't believe we put up with you as long as we did. Beat it.
Good riddance.
How dare you! After everything we've done!
Forget this, we have credits to make!
Your work against Revan and his followers has been truly exceptional. And your expertise in combating the Emperor is second to none.
You embody every ideal in the Jedi Code. The Council is unanimous in its decision to name you Battlemaster of the order.
The Council has often sensed darkness in your actions, and we hope to guide you away from such influence. But your prowess cannot be dismissed.
You do not always follow a path the Council understands. But we have seen the results of your unorthodox approach time and again.
I hereby name you Battlemaster of the Jedi Order.
As Battlemaster, your strategic insights will guide the Council's decisions, and you will share your lightsaber skills with the order's most promising students.
But most important of all, you will lead the charge against the Sith Emperor, along with any who choose to follow him.
I am honored to be chosen for this role in the order. I will do everything I can to fulfill my duties with wisdom and skill.
Thank you very much.
With your help, I believe we can finally bring an end to the Emperor's assaults on the galaxy.
I'm ready. How should we begin?
When do we start?
It's good to know that the Council finally appreciates what I'm capable of.
Finally, proper acknowledgment.
What we are capable of and what we accomplish are often different. We're hoping you'll accomplish a great deal of good in the galaxy.
Your role in bringing light to the Revanites' conspiracy is only further proof of your tremendous skill and connection to the Force.
What's more, you've battled against the Children of the Emperor and triumphed where so many others fell.
The order needs to remain vigilant against the Emperor's influences, and to uncover the true origins of his power so that we can fight him more effectively.
The Council is proud to have such an ideal Jedi to lead those efforts.
Despite the darkness we have sensed in you, the Council can think of no one better suited to lead those efforts.
You walk a... unique path, but your insights are equally unique, and the council believes that you are the best choice for our investigations.
Congratulations, Barsen'thor. You will be the light that guides us through the coming darkness.
This is a grave task, and I'm honored that you would entrust it to me.
Thank you very much.
Knowledge will be our greatest weapon in the battles to come.
There's no time to waste--the Emperor is already far ahead of us. Where can I begin?
I should begin immediately.
After all that I've accomplished, you think this is a suitable reward?
Not much of a reward.
Thanks to your old boss, SpecForce division is going through some changes. We can't afford to lose Havoc Squad in that mire of bureaucracy.
A special joint task force is being assembled between the Jedi, the SIS, and the military. Destroying the Sith Emperor is the group's sole purpose.
On the recommendation of Supreme Commander Malcom, you have been appointed to serve as the task force's primary military advisor. Congratulations.
I can't think of a more important mission to be a part of. I'm honored.
Thank you very much.
Do we have any intel to act on yet?
What do we know so far?
I'll take whatever title you want. But don't expect me to sit behind a desk.
Don't pull me out of the field.
If this situation with the Revanites has proven anything, it's the value of having eyes and ears outside of the Republic.
You've done good work as a licensed privateer, but the SIS wants you to be able to go even further.
This card is programmed with authorization codes from the director of the SIS himself. Complete immunity from Republic prosecution of any kind.
Take any job you can find, if you think it might lead to information on the Emperor and his followers. I mean it.
The minute I hear anything useful, I'll send it your way.
You can count on me.
This has to be the best reward I've ever gotten for a job. I can't decide where to go first!
I can't wait to try it!
Yeah, sure, I'll get right on that.
[Lie] Of course! You've got it!
Just don't make us regret trusting you, all right?
We're attempting to calculate where the Emperor might have gone, but we don't know enough about his capabilities to determine anything for sure.
While we get the task force up and running, we're going to need you out there, acting on your own. Follow every lead you can find.
Until the Emperor is destroyed for good, the entire galaxy is in danger. We must be ready.
There's more for us to discuss.
It was not intended as a reward.
We're lucky to have you.
Wouldn't dream of it. "Primary military advisor" just sounded nicer than "head bad-guy killer."
Perfect.
Just remember, that only works for Republic security forces. You get arrested on some unaligned planet nobody's heard of, you're on your own.
And remember, the threat of the Empire remains--they will not hesitate to use this situation to gain an advantage over us.
Back to toeing the line, at least for a while.
Agreed.
I don't, though Marr did ask to speak with me as soon as we've launched.
Despite our work here, trust is still in short supply. We can thank the Revanites for that.
Neither will I.
I'd say you've earned it. Though I doubt your superiors would be interested in my opinion.
I appreciate the offer, but... no.
Yes, I'd say so.
Of course.
But I'll probably just take off on my own for a bit first. It's about time I enjoyed some of my credits again.
As sound a plan as I've ever heard.
I appreciate the invitation. But the Empire is my home.
Can I get that in writing?
I'd bet on it.
Our jobs have a lot in common.
I could say the same about you.
Can't say that surprises me too much.
Soldiers are only as good as their training, and I went through my share.
Training is everything.
Then your teachers deserve some medals.
I did it all because I had your help every step of the way.
It's all about teamwork.
Other than when I was captured. But I appreciate the sentiment.
Following orders, staying in formations... I've never been big on any of it. Missions like this are much more exciting.
This was the fun stuff.
Don't have to convince me.
That a fact?
There can't be much left to learn anyway.
This has all been much more fun than dying at the bottom of an ocean!
I have never seen you fail before! You will not start now.
Think I've found the locks Iven mentioned. You'd better get out there and take a look--we'll feed you info as we find it.
May the Force serve you well.
Good luck.
...I'm sure we'll be fine. I'll stay in contact while you're getting those sensors up.
Come on. We'd better go check up on the bosses.
I thank you, tiny friends.
You're on. [Kiss him]
